refnamediv.refpurpose: Move hosts or clusters between sandboxes/domains

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The aq manage command takes a host or cluster, and makes it build its configuration using the specified template domain or sandbox. This allows you to test building hosts using alternate templates, or to move a host back to a default production domain once testing has completed.

The aq manage command by default verifies that the required templates exist in any domains used by any hosts or clusters affected by the new binding. Note that this check merely tests the existence of the templates - no functional testing is performed. Hosts or clusters in sandboxes are not checked, expecting the owners of such sandboxes to take care about any potential problems themselves. This check can be disabled using the --force option.

The aq manage command by default also verifies that the configuration moves forward, that is, the target branch (domain or sandbox) contains all commits of the current branch of the objects. If the objects currently are in a sandbox, the command verifies that there are no uncommitted or unpublished changes will be left behind, to prevent losing such changes by mistake. These checks can also be disabled using the --force option.

refsect1.title: Templates
refsect1.para: This command will modify the templates for the host or cluster (depending on which option was given).
